data: Refer to Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults
Hypoglycemia: for blood glucose below 4 mmol/L

If blood glucose is 2.8 to 3.9 mmol/L:  1. Administer 15 g of carbohydrates. If blood sugar is below 2.8 mmol/L administer 20 g of carbohydrate  2. Repeat blood glucose in 15 min and repeat carbohydrate if blood sugar below 4 mmol/L    3. Repeat blood glucose in 15 min, if blood glucose remains below 4 mmol/L notify Provider / NP for further treatment.  If ambulatory or community call 911  4. Once blood glucose is above 3.9 mmol/L, recheck blood glucose 1 hour post last result and refer to follow up instructions in the Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults
For further treatment, if blood glucose remains below 4 mmol/L after repeating blood glucose reading x 3 in total
Once blood glucose is above 3.9 mmol/L, recheck blood glucose 1 hour post last result and refer to follow up instructions in the Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults
